page.title: 07Ecology
page.content: Around Clovelly there are many lovely {walks}including the coastal footpath and a nature trail. Many{streams}have their source in the area and have deeply wooded valleys as they flow to the sea. Much of the deciduous wood land is mature with some newer coniferous plantations giving contrast Most woods are in steep valleys where the plough cannot reach. In fields where in the past hedges had been grubbed up to make them larger, crop rotation is practised and farm yard manure is spread. Fuchsia, geraniums and rhododendrons do especially well. Gorse flourishes in the Devon hedgebanks and on the cliffsides .Domestic rubbish is collected by Torridge.D.C., although there are old tips. There is a sewerage outlet into the sea.
